intro: Bouvardia hendersonii, commonly known as Henderson's bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of fragrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms throughout the year in suitable conditions. Bouvardia hendersonii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
